1.text: “Amen, amen, I tell you; whoever does not enter by the gate into the sheep fold, but climbs up some other way is a thief and a robber.

2.text: But the one who enters by the gate is the shepherd of the sheep.

3.text: The gatekeeper opens the gate for him, and the sheep listen to his voice. The shepherd calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.

4.text: And whenever he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them and the sheep follow him because they know his voice.

5.text: They will by no means follow a stranger, but flee from him because they do not recognize the voice of strangers.”

6.text: Jesus spoke this parable to them, but they did not understand what he was telling them.

7.text: Jesus therefore said to them again, “Amen, amen, I tell you; I am the gate for the sheep.

8.text: All who have come before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them.

9.text: I am the gate! Anyone who enters in by me will be saved, and go in and out, and will find pasture.

10.text: The thief only comes to steal, kill, and destroy. I came so that people may have life, and have it in abundance.

11.text: I am the good shepherd! The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

12.text: The one who is a hired hand, not a shepherd, and who does not own the sheep, leaves the sheep and flees when he sees the wolf coming. Then the wolf snatches the sheep and scatters them.

13.text: The hired hand flees because he is a hired hand and does not care for the sheep.

14.text: I am the good shepherd! I know my own, and I am known by my own;

15.text: even as the Father knows me, and I know the Father. I lay down my life for the sheep.

16.text: I have other sheep, which are not of this fold. I must bring them also, and they will hear my voice. And there will be one flock—one shepherd.

17.text: Therefore, the Father loves me, because I lay down my life, so that I may take it again.

18.text: No one takes my life away from me, but I lay it down of my own accord. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. I received this commandment from my Father.”

19.text: Once again, a division arose among the Jews on account of these words.

20.text: Many of them said, “He has a demon and he is insane! Why do you listen to him?”

21.text: Others said, “These are not the sayings of someone possessed by a demon. It is not possible for a demon to open the eyes of the blind, is it?”

22.text: At that time, it was the Feast of the Dedication in Jerusalem.

23.text: It was winter, and Jesus was walking in the temple, in Solomon’s porch.

24.text: The Jews therefore gathered around him and asked him, “How long will you hold us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”

25.text: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you do not believe. The works that I do in my Father’s Name, these bear witness to me.

26.text: But you do not believe, because you are not of my sheep, as I told you.

27.text: My sheep hear my voice; I know them, and they follow me.

28.text: I give eternal life to them; they will never perish, and no one will snatch them out of my hand.

29.text: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them out of my Father’s hand.

30.text: I and the Father are one.”

31.text: Again, the Jews picked up rocks to stone him.

32.text: Jesus told them, “I have shown you many good works from my Father. For which of those do you stone me?”

33.text: The Jews answered him, “We do not stone you for a good work, but for blasphemy: because you, being a man, make yourself God.”

34.text: Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods?’

35.text: If he called them gods, (those to whom the word of God came, and the Scripture cannot be broken),

36.text: do you say of him whom the Father has consecrated and sent into the world, ‘You blaspheme,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God?’

37.text: If I do not do the works of my Father, do not believe me.

38.text: But if I do them, even though you do not believe me, believe the works, so that you may recognize and believe that the Father is in me, and I in him.”

39.text: Therefore they sought again to seize him, but he escaped out of their hand.

40.text: He went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was baptizing at first, and he stayed there.

41.text: Many came to him, saying, “John indeed did no sign, but everything that John said about this man is true!”

42.text: And many believed in him there.
